meanings: (정보나 지식을 갖추다) know, learn, have (good) knowledge (of), be familiar (with)
(이해하다) understand, know, see, follow, appreciate, (informal) get, make out
(깨닫다, 인지하다) realize, recognize, find, notice, sense, (formal) perceive, be aware (of), be conscious (of)
Knowing too much is a disease, Where ignorance is bliss, it is folly to be wise, Ignorance is the peace of life
Knowing too much is a disease, Where ignorance is bliss, it is folly to be wise, Ignorance is the peace of life
You can never defeat someone who knows more than you do
(잘난 체하다) act like one knows everything
to the best of my knowledge

examples.korean: She disclaimed any knowledge of her husband’s whereabouts. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그녀는 남편의 행방에 대해 전혀 아는 바가 없다고 말했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: She disclaimed any knowledge of her husband’s whereabouts. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: He’s a known thief. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그는 사람들이 아는[소문난] 도둑이다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: He’s a known thief. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: It is instructive to see how other countries are tackling the problem. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 다른 국가들이 그 문제에 어떻게 대처하고 있는지를 보는[아는] 것은 유익하다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: It is instructive to see how other countries are tackling the problem. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: He’s just a business acquaintance. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그는 그냥 사업상 아는 사람이다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: He’s just a business acquaintance. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: There is no need to state the obvious. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 누구나 다 아는 것은 말할 필요가 없다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: There is no need to state the obvious. Add to Wordbook
